sentence: In an attempt to further its online operations, information technology ("IT") transitions and overall strategies, The Home Depot, Inc.HD announced a host of expansion plans.
Firstly, the company intends to introduce its third direct fulfillment center, which will be the company's largest one to date.
Spanning over 1.6 million square feet and situated in Troy Township, OH, this facility is anticipated to generate about 500 employment opportunities.
The company had earlier opened two fulfillment centers last year - one each in Locust Grove, GA and Perris, CA.
These three openings are in line with Home Depot's aim of sustaining online sales growth, as the latter currently contributes to nearly 5% of its total revenue.
These facilities enable the company to ensure speedy delivery of about 90% of the online orders via low-cost service.
Further, Home Depot announced plans to open a new technology center in Marietta, GA.
The Marietta Technology Center, which will benefit more than 1,000 IT associates, will span over 200,000 square feet.
Also, this facility, slated to open in October, will create approximately 500 new jobs in the IT field.
This move complements Home Depot's eight-year long focus on improving its IT capacities, along with bringing supply chain efficiencies and merchandising transformations.
Finally, the company announced that it is on track to add a new Online Customer Care facility in November that will be located in Tempe, AZ.
This will be Home Depot's third such facility, concentrated on supporting online operations by hiring about 800 members.
The company had opened its previous online support centers in Kennesaw, GA and Ogden, Utah.
The objective behind opening the third facility is to take the company's interconnected retail plans forward and enhance customer relations.

These openings will not only help this Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) company to achieve growth via expansion, but also augment economic development of the respective regions by creating significant job opportunities.

Other Stocks to Consider

Other well-ranked retail stocks worth considering include Casey's General Stores, Inc. CASY , with a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Target Corp. TGT and Best Buy Co., Inc. BBY , each with a Zacks Rank #2.
